The wild wood bison were successfully reintroduced to the United States. The moment was captured on video by Alaska Department of Fish and Game Biologist Tom Seaton. The land mammals were freed from a temporary pen, where they had been kept for just over a week. Wood bison are North America's largest land mammal, but the native Alaskan species disappeared from the state more than 100 years ago.

YouTube user Elman511 cracked open an over-sized egg that was laid by one of his hens. He found a standard-sized egg inside, along with yolk and white. The unusual occurrence is down to a counter-peristalsis contraction. This is when a second oocyte is released by the hen's ovary before the first egg has completely traveled through the oviduct. This causes the second oocyte to travel down the oviduct and is covered in a shell, creating a giant egg around the first one.

Pixium Vision is being sold to the blind and has clinical trials scheduled for 2016. It is based on a technique known as 'neuromodulation' in which electricity stimulated the nervous system to restore sight. A surgeon first implanted chip with 150 electrodes on the retina. The authority to collect those records and other similar surveillance provisions of the Patriot Act. 'Marilyn Einstein' was created by superimposing a blurry picture of Marilyn Monroe. Features with high spatial frequency (Einstein) are only visible when you're viewing them close up. Those with low spatial frequencies (Monroe) are only visible from further away. Combining pictures of the two produces a single image which changes when the viewer moves closer or farther away.

Scientists at the University of Connecticut say we know how far away the source of a sound is by listening to the echoes it produces. They found that the reverberations of sound helps us locate the distance of a car passing round a bend or a person nearby. The research was conducted by scientists from the University of Connecticut. They said that echoes and fluctuations in volume are the cues we use to figure out the distance between us and the source of a noise.

As short waves collide near the surface they create weak microseismic waves. These waves combine with long waves on the oceans floor to create a constant hum. Earthquakes shake the planet in such a way that it can oscillate for months after the seismic activity.

Greenstone is a small egg-shaped gadget that acts like a beacon, or a beacon. It helps messages move around so-called wireless mesh networks more than ever. It uses a feature that launched in iOS 7 called Multipeer Connectivity Framework. This lets users send messages to people in close proximity that are in Bluetooth or Wi-Fi Direct. But there are limits to how far a message can travel in this way.

One-Touch-911 app was designed by researchers at Boston-based MIT. It works with emergency dispatchers in 135 countries. Each of the four buttons trigger a standard call to dispatchers. Each call is placed with the phone's GPS location, user details and any pre-entered medical information attached. If the user doesn't have signal on their network, the app lets them 'roam' onto another network to connect the call.

A University of Nebraska researcher has revealed why stress is bad for you in a video. Limited periods of stress are good, as they release the hormone cortisol. This is useful in helping you recover from very tense situations. But too much will lower the immune system and make your bones fragile. The science of stress was explained in a video by Dr Raychelle Burks from the University of Nebraska-Lincoln. She reveals that prolonged periods of stress can inhibit the immune system.

Researchers in Tokyo, noted that rats flatten their ears and narrow their eyes when they are in pain. They also puff up their cheeks when they are in pain. To test the rodents' response to rats' pained expressions, they showed them the photos in a specially made cage. They found that rats spent less time in the room showing rodents in pain than they did in the other compartment showing rats with neutral expressions.

Geologist Dr Danny Hilman claims that a site in West Java is revered because it hides an ancient temple built between 9,000 and 20,000 years ago. The megalithic site of Gunung Padang was discovered in 1914 and is the largest site of its kind in Indonesia. It is located 75 miles (120km) south of Jakarta, and is considered sacred by the Sundanese people who live locally. If the structure is revealed to be a 20,000-year-old pyramid, it will be the oldest on Earth.

Shoe that Grows has adjustable points at the front, sides and the back of the sandal to help it expand. Kenton Lee, from Nampa, Idaho, came up with the idea while working in Nairobi, Kenya. He saw children running around barefoot and in shoes several sizes too small. Pressure sensors in the shoe tells it when your foot is in position, triggering a tiny motor in the heel. When you want to take off the shoes, click your heels together twice and the motor will loosen the laces.

Ice is not just at the Martian poles, but likely to the equator as well as the equator. This means that, if all ice were to be spread across the surface of Mars, the entire planet would be covered in more than 3.3ft. The '#kyliejennerchallenge' is sweeping social media, encouraging teens to blow their lips up to epic proportions. Participants place their mouth over the opening of a cup, jar or shot glass and sucking in until the air vacuum causes their lips to swell up. Countless teens, both boys and girls, have been sharing their results on Twitter and Instagram. The method works by way of the airlock created in the opening of the glass or jar.

Swiss researchers measured the temperature of 'Hot Jupiter' HD 189733b. They found the temperature reaches up to 3,000°C in the atmosphere. And wind speeds are in excess of 620 miles per hour. Spanish researchers say climate change impacted human migration. Until 1.4 million years ago it was too cold to inhabit southeast Spain. But then the climate warmed to 13°C (55°F) and became more humid. This enabled hominins - our distant ancestors. - to move to new regions. And it is thought that the earliest humans were a'slow-moving' species.

They, rancher Larry Scherich and his wife, Phyllis, do not have to worry about unexpected visitors, nor noisy neighbors. Instead, they encounter only hired workers in the town, which once housed the largest cattle ranch in Kansas's history.

The study was conducted by scientists at Purdue University in Indiana. They were investigating how to reduce bird to aircraft collisions by keeping birds away from planes. Research showed that birds responded most to blue lights on planes. Tokyo researchers have proposed a laser system to attach to the ISS. It would be used to shoot down pieces of debris in Earth orbit. The system would have a range of 62 miles (100km) and could target things less than 0.4 inches (1cm) in size. It would then push space junk into Earth's atmosphere to burn up. The paper was published in Acta Astronautica.

Deep water gas hydrates in the Arctic are reservoirs for abiotic methane. The gas forms through a process called serpentinisation. It occurs when seawater reacts with hot mantle rocks exhumed along large faults within the seafloor. The reservoirs are secure, and scientists don't believe they will impact climate change. Instead, they say similar formations could be used to store methane, which can later be used as fuel.

Researchers from National Chung Hsing University in Taiwan found that the shape of the lip is determined by two competing groups of proteins. They found that the lip is a large and irregular modified petal, called the 'L' complex and the 'SP' complex, which compete to promote the formation of the lip and standard petal. They found that the lip is a large and irregular modified petal, called the 'L' complex, which is used to attract insects. The study extends scientists' understanding of the mechanisms leading to the diversity of orchid flowers.

The Nanoheat Wireless Heated Mug is fitted with a rcharged battery, nanoheater and heat sleeve. It can maintain temperature of hot drinks at between 68°C and 71°C (155 and 160°F) for up to 45 minutes. The mug weighs a little over one pound (454g) and can be charged wirelessly or using a traditional USB cord.
